intro: Psychotria urceolata, commonly known as the "cup-shaped Psychotria," is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its striking, urn-shaped flowers that are typically blue or violet in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in rainforests. Psychotria urceolata is also noted for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional medicine for various purposes.
